snippet: The 1996 ruling, which was kept in place on a tie vote, exempted limited-liability companies from corporate campaign contribution limits, allowing wealthy donors to make huge multiple contributions.
abstract: New York State Board of Elections is at 2-to-2 deadlock over whether to rescind 1996 ruling allowing limited liability companies to be treated as individuals and to donate up to $60,800 to statewide candidate per election cycle; tie allows law to stand.
lead_paragraph: The 1996 ruling, which was kept in place on a tie vote, exempted limited-liability companies from corporate campaign contribution limits, allowing wealthy donors to make huge multiple contributions.

headline.main: New York State Elections Board Retains a Corporate Donation Loophole
headline.print_headline: State Elections Board Retains a Corporate Donation Loophole
